text: mogwai say thanks everyone for sending the questions in .
see you all soon - cheers !
pete fellows asks what 's your opinion of your german edm almost-namesake and have you told him to get an original moniker ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 2:04pm s : i do n't know much about his music , but i think he 's been using the name longer than we have .
we 've managed to peacefully coexist .
richxs says my mrs reckons ether sounds a bit like the crocodile dundee soundtrack .
who 's your favourite dundonian ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 2:03pm s : mine is brian cox .
d : that 's who i was going to say !
he 's just the best hannibal lecter .
s : that 's what i was going to say !
i 've never seen crocodile dundee , at least not for a while .
scorchthebluedragon asks stuart : what was it like working with rachel goswell and james and justin lockey for the minor victories project ?
what should we expect from the album and upcoming live shows ?
the couple of bits that have seen the light of day so far have been fantastic , btw .
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 2:00pm s : it was really great working with rachel , james and justin - the album was a lot of fun to make .
expect ten good songs that people like .
it 's totally done .
the live shows are sounding good , martin from mogwai is playing drums with us live , another guy callum is playing keys - rehearsals are sounding good and we 're looking forward to it .
listen to minor victories : a hundred ropes
id9552055 asks no doubt you are musicians above all but are you also driven as a scottish or a british band ?
and scotland , independent or part of the union ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:59pm s : we did all vote yes .
the democratic deficit of scotland continually being run by politicians no-one in scotland voted for , and the pile of nuclear weapons parked up .

documents.title: the band 's favourite gig venues
text: mwng2k asks with such an extensive back catalogue to choose from , how do you go about putting your setlists together ?
are there any live venues that you would love to play at , but have not yet had the opportunity to visit ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:56pm s : the setlist - you put a good song to start with , a good song to end with , and you fill in the middle .
if you have a new record you put some of those in , plus ones you 've been enjoying playing on tour .
d : it does n't take long to work out what tunes work the best live , and they 're the ones that usually stick about .
s : we 've been lucky - we 've played a lot of great places .
my favourite venue is the glasgow barrowlands .
i really like the hammersmith apollo .
d : i really miss the astoria - that was a great place to play .
s : the bikini in toulouse .
there 's a nice dog hanging out there that i like .
d : the guy who owns the place cooks you a dinner and it 's unbelievable .
we do n't always sell a huge amount of tickets , but we get a lot of booze and tasty food .
simon bleasdale asks who is the girl speaking at the beginning of the young team album , on yes , i am a long way from home ?
what is she doing now ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:52pm s : that is a person called mari , who was one of the first people to book a mogwai gig outside of the uk .
we went to play in norway in 1996 , and we played in oslo , stavanger and bergen .
it was brilliant tour - we slept on the venue floors quite a lot .

what she 's saying is her translating a review , a really hyperbole-filled review we thought was hilarious because the concept of someone taking our music seriously was sidesplittingly amusing to us .
even having it at the beginning of the record was meant to be funny , but it 's been taken more seriously over the years , which is quite nice .
mari still lives in bergen , she 's got a family - she 's still doing well .
we see her any time we 're around there .
mykell pledger asks : would mogwai do the soundtrack to a live-action akira movie ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:53pm s : oh yeah .
d : undoubtedly .
s : presuming it was brilliant , which we would presume , until it was n't .
d : it 's one of those ones in production hell is n't it - it 's going to be very hard to make it into a good film .
lh100lh asks what are the last 5 records you both bought ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:49pm s : i got some two days ago .
i went to edinburgh to do a radio interview and - namedrop klaxon - i met ian rankin in a second hand record shop .
i got a section 25 12 '' , a strawberry switchblade album , butthole surfers , squirrel bait , and the new tim hecker album which is amazing .
d : it 's too long !
i 've no idea .
cqwellingbonephd says saw you in st malo , france in 2011 .
best and worst things about touring ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:48pm s : the best thing is getting to play a concert every night .
d : flying and anything to do with airports gets pretty gruelling after a while .
everything else is pretty good .
djsatan asks : i always thought it plausible that you could have had a fight .
who would win ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:47pm s : i think if mogwai had a fight , martin would win .
d : he 's by far the hardest .
there would be lots of shouting , and some feeble punches .
s : i 'd lose in a fight against myself .
gimpyblog 2d says saw you play years ago in edinburgh with arab strap .
i was so wasted i ca n't remember anything about the gig .
was it any good ?
and robin layfield adds if it was the one on valentine 's day that ended with stuart punching a giant rupert bear on stage while playing then it was bloody brilliant .
2nd best mogwai gig ever ( after closing glastonbury and blowing the crowd down like dandelions under a lawnmower ) .
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:45pm s : we were wasted too .
d : i got pretty steaming .
my strongest memory is that i kicked my pint over and it landed in a cable box , and the girl manning the monitor desk tore right through me on stage .
i felt pretty bad .
it was an accident though .
porcinho asks : if you 'd never done zidane , who would be the top 3 players you 'd like to soundtrack a film about ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:46pm s : diego maradona .
henrik larsson .
lubomir moravcik .
sigma66 asks : 606 or 808 ?

guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:44pm s : presuming you do n't mean the terrible football phone-in ian wright , i do n't think he 's funny , he just seems self-satisfied and disinterested , and he was terrible in his short period for celtic .
d : i remember when he was a pundit when northern ireland beat england - he would n't speak , he was too furious .
it 's literally your job to speak about games !
s : there you go , keep employing this guy , bbc - who shows licence fee payers utter contempt !
ian wright scores for celtic v kilmarnock , 30 october 1999 .
curtis/pa
kitegirluk says saw you guys at pitchfork paris in 2014 .
immediately catapulted into my top 3 live acts .
spontaneously burst into tears during one song when really quiet became really , really loud .
my question is : have you ever done a buckfast challenge ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:41pm d : no .
that 's mental .
s : that could kill you , surely ?
dvdmwr asks : not a mogwai question , more a rock action one , but is james orr complex ever going to put out another record ?
it 's been almost eight years !
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:41pm s : chris now lives in sao paolo but is still making music , so i really hope he does put out a new record .
his are some of the best we 've ever put out .

documents.title: thatcher and cameron : 'two cheeks of the same arse '
text: porcinho asks who , in your opinion , is worse , cameron or thatcher ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:40pm s : i would probably say cameron because the damage he 's doing , he 's inflicting it now .
and cameron is doing things thatcher would n't have dared to do - taking away housing benefits for the under 21s , cutting the disability benefits , fucking a pig .
just generally being a complete evil bastard .
but they 're two cheeks of the same arse .
staffy82 asks : i once heard a story from your ex-manager about youse buying a gun and shooting fk out of a hire car when you were recording rock action .
is it true and can you elaborate ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:38pm s : i 'll answer and i wo n't name names .
the gun was not bought .
d : it was the studio 's gun .
s : and it was used as a weapon to destroy a hire car .
d : we had spent a fair bit of time in that studio and it was in the middle of nowhere - cabin fever had set in a bit .
we had to get a taxi home .
donfortissimo asks what do you think about the scotland away kit ?
and when do you think we 'll ever qualify for another major tournament ?
if we did , would you play an electric version of flower of scotland as the anthem ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:37pm s : the pink away kit is a national disgrace .
it almost makes me glad we did n't qualify for the euros .
i think scotland have a decent chance of qualifying for the next euros if the group is a bit kinder to us - i think the world cup might be a bit of a stretch .
the thing about flower of scotland is that it should be acoustic , it 's quite a gentle song , and people ruin it by doing it shouty .
so maybe we would go acoustic for that !
in the pink kits .
moggieboy asks : alan mcgee - good guy or wank ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:35pm s : alan mcgee is without doubt a very good guy .
d : he 's lovely .
a brilliant guy to go out for dinner with - you 'll be entertained .
we did n't work with him that long , a year maybe .
he 's quite keen on omelettes .
he always gets one .
don van vliet asks what 's the best song or album title you 've ever come up with ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:33pm s : central belters ' working title was the shiteist pish .
d : my cat was sitting in the lounge giving me a nasty look , and i remembered we had a song called the glower of a cat , which we thought was hilarious for about two months .
it 's not even funny .
s : do you remember what hunted by a freak was originally called ?
d : moomin cum .
alex arditti asks : what exactly is a glasgow mega-snake ?

guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:31pm s : it 's a mythical creature that me and barry thought would be a good thing to live in the river clyde to bring tourists to glasgow in the same way that the loch ness monster brings to loch ness .
but every day , the monster would eat a tourist , and people would gather for the sacrifice .
we have n't pitched it to the tourist board yet .
brian cash asks are any of you beatles fans ?
if so , favourite album ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:29pm s : the best of the beatles .
chiprock asks : i saw that stuart spoke to limmy on twitter the other day .
how about a collaboration ?
limmy doing some bleak ramblings over a mogwai soundtrack ?
it could work , i reckon .
a bit chris morris maybe .
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:29pm s : i 'd probably rather have a coffee and a laugh than a musical collaboration .
the mogwai-limmy supergroup is one ice .
i 'd do music for a show maybe .
realtruthteller asks stuart , when are you going vegan ?
: ) guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:28pm s : are you the guy in starbucks earlier , when i was looking sadly at muffins ?
i 've been vegan for a week - are you stalking me ?
arraiga2 asks : would you give ronny deila another year at celtic ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:27pm s : i personally would , but the team definitely need to improve .
diplomatic football answer .

hexenductionhour says not a question , but i 'd just like to apologise on behalf of the city of belfast for the time you played the mandela hall students ' union on a friday night and all the students talked loudly throughout your entire set .
you looked annoyed and i was annoyed for you .
also what 's your favourite song/album by the fall ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:26pm s : thank you for your apology .
that was one of the most unpleasant concerts we 've ever played .
my favourite song by the fall is probably deadbeat descendent , and my favourite album is the marshall suite .
d : my knowledge of the fall is poor .
s : the best of the fall !

documents.title: mogwai at ibrox ? ? ?
text: tasnim asks : would you prefer to play ibrox stadium as support to iggy pop , or celtic park as support for nickelback ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:25pm s : iggy at ibrox .
although i would n't like to be the person who cleaned up the graffiti in the dressing room .
spooonman asks what 's your favourite helmet album ?
and stuart , what adidas are you wearing in the promo pic [ below ] ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:24pm s : they are adidas palace shoes .
they 're knitted .

documents.title: the message of atomic
text: jackersonjack01 asks : ok serious question : given the subject matter of mark cousins ' film , atomic , and the shameful amount of millions spent on trident , do you hope the political message is still obvious despite obviously there being no lyrics ?

guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:23pm s : i think the political message is very obvious , especially given the quote from mark in the cd - it 's basically a sort of very well put indictment of the way that nuclear science has been used in a negative way .
it 's not ambiguous in any way .
listen to u-235 from atomic while you chat
david holloway asks any plans for a live show for atomic , in the same way you did for zidane : 21st century portrait ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:20pm s : yes , we 're starting doing atomic shows in may , in edinburgh , coventry and london , in august and september .
and japan - we 're going to do it in hiroshima .
we played there before .
one of the reason we were so keen to do the soundtrack was that we 'd visited the peace park there , and it was a very affecting experience .
trickymickey asks : if you could soundtrack the films of a director of your choice past or present , who would it be ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:22pm s : stanley kubrick .
it 's not going to happen .
d : late period john carpenter , because his soundtracks for them are n't very good .
his early ones are brilliant though .

documents.title: guitar pedals mogwai have worked with
text: chris mccormack asks : weirdest guitar pedal ?
the more disgusting the better .

guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:18pm s : the weirdest was one that tatty , who used to play with the cocteau twins , gave to me - it had a light sensor where you waved your hands to change the pitch .
s : the worst was a dod .
i loved grunge music , but i was too young to realise it was classic 60s fuzz pedals that created that sound .
d : that was an absolute piece of shit .
it was terrible .
s : it was fucking landfill .
d : i 've got a pedal called the wizard of pitch .
it 's really hard to make it do anything remotely melodic .
it glides up to the pitch you 've selected so it sounds out of tune .
s : like a snoop dogg album when you 're drunk .
d : but when you 've got it right , it 's good .
it 's rewarding .
jamie cox asks hi guys .
i just bought atomic , but as it 's a soundtrack album i wondered if u had still been writing/recording new material for a follow up to rave tapes ?
also , are there any live dates planned for 2016 in the uk .
been too long since i 've seen ya ! ! ! ! !

thanks guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:15pm s : we are in the middle of writing songs for our next record , and we 're going to go and record with dave fridmann at the end of the year .
exclusive klaxon !
it 's early i 'm hoping the final product is nothing like the demos !
hannes siegl asks : ever thought about a max richter collaboration ?
one can dream , right ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:14pm s : i recently remixed a song from max 's sleep album , available in all good record shops .
and it would be great if he did something with mogwai , he 's a very talented man .
djshuggg asks will you ever ( in all seriousness ) do an acoustic album of your finer moments ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:13pm d : we will never do an acoustic album , ever .
s : it 's a truly terrible idea .
d : i 'm interested to know why people are asking this s : i own an acoustic guitar but i 'm not going to play mogwai songs on it in a studio .
just covers in glasgow city centre for loose change .
ussruready2rumble asks : can i come visit barry in his bar and talk smack about post-rock as a whole ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:12pm s : as long as you buy a drink , you can say what you want in barry 's bar .
djshuggg asks there was talk about you recording music for the guardian football podcast .
did james richardson 's reply to barry 's suggestion put you off ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:12pm s : no , because i 'm a lazy bastard .
but if someone was to wheel a pile of cash round the corner right now
duhusker asks : it felt really special seeing you guys at the sydney opera house last year .
does playing that kind venue feel like a big deal for you guys ( or is it just another gig ) ?
secondly , i guess does the venue/acoustics ever dictate your set list sometimes ( theatre vs club vs outdoor etc ) ?
just curious .
thanks for the great music over all these years , it means so much to so many of us .
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:11pm d : it was definitely a big deal playing the opera house - it was terrifying !
secondly , what can dictate the sets is that it 's not always the venue , but noise limits , especially in europe .
when we 're playing a show somewhere like that we start off with a lot of quiet songs and build it up over the set .
s : also if you 're at a festival next to a dance tent , there 's no point playing quiet ones - you 'll just have diplo over the tender moments .
david johnson asks : aside from post-rock , what is the most ridiculous label/genre that your music has been associated with ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:09pm s : `` the new wave of teenage bands . ''
featuring ash and kenickie .
we probably turned 20 a week after this page-filling article in the nme .

documents.title: mogwai like bowie
text: threegirlrumba asks : hi what is your favorite album by bowie , and also by wire ?
( but libbets says : surely bowie is shite ?
this is mogwai . )
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:09pm s : low , and pink flag .
d : really boringly i 'm going to say low , it 's a belter .
and secondly , i do n't like wire .

niall asks : how do you feel that , although bands can often make long term careers ' out of making music , they only really ever produce one seminal , cohesive piece of work during this ( if at all of course ! ) .
what would you say is mogwai 's one seminal , cohesive piece of work ?
for me it 's zidane .
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:08pm s : i disagree .
i think lots of bands have produced numerous seminal pieces of work , in fact there are some where every single thing is seminal .
bowie , leonard cohen , my bloody valentine , low , public enemy .
d : if you ask someone what their favourite low album is , they 're all different .
s : if i had to one of ours it 's come on die young .
d : i 'd choose happy songs .
it all flows together as one whole piece .
fatharrywhite asks : what are the best a ) curry houses , and b ) whisky shops in glasgow ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:05pm d : the best place for whisky is a shop called the good spirits company .
s : i actually think it 's asda .
the best three curry houses are banana leaf , mother india and balbir 's .
that 's maybe what we can do for my birthday actually .
jackerson asks : when will you release some new music ?
and have you ever considered playing in glasgow ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:04pm s : this is so obviously barry burns .
hi barry !
d : any time stuart puts something on instagram , barry writes a comment saying : please come to hamilton .
or something like that .
mogwai in a pr shot for atomic sweeney tasnim asks : who 's the dug ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:03pm s : the dog is called albion .
we had to mostly hold him because he was trying to bite the photographer .

documents.title: we 're off
text: ilgatto asks : what 's your favourite comic book / graphic novel ?
guardian contributor mogwaiband 06 april 2016 1:02pm stuart : mine is from hell by alan moore .
i read it when i was pretty young and i had to sleep with the lights on for a week .
it 's a very psychedelic piece of writing .
dominic : i read it when you lent it to me - it 's an absolutely demented piece of work .
what 's mine ?
i do n't know s : come on !
you love comics !
d : i could n't i 'm useless at things like this .

documents.title: post your questions for mogwai
text: when they emerged in the mid-90s , mogwai would create screaming feedback between their guitars and amps , assaulting their audience with sheets of pure noise as well as taunting a certain britpop band with their infamous blur : are shite t-shirts .
a more stately sound has emerged from that early insanity .
the scots are now celebrated exponents of a craggy but uplifting kind of instrumental rock , increasingly laced with electronics .

they 've just released their ninth studio album , atomic , a reworked version of their soundtrack to mark cousins ' bbc documentary atomic : living in dread and promise , which adds to their soundtracks for douglas gordon 's documentary zidane , darren aronofsky film the fountain and french tv drama les revenants .
with atomic out now , stuart braithwaite and dominic aitchison from the band are joining us to answer your questions in a live webchat on wednesday 6 april , from 1pm bst onwards .
post them in the comments below , and they 'll answer as many as possible .
